tournament.name: Cards of War's 3v3 Legacy Major II

decks.notes: The deck utilizes Cloudpost lands and ramping artifacts to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer, Ulamog, and Emrakul. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to hinder opponents' plans, while maintaining a high mana generation with cards like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a large number of Eldrazi threats while controlling the game through disruption and massive spells like All Is Dust.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Cloudpost lands and artifact accelerants like Thran Dynamo and Grim Monolith to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog and Emrakul. It also utilizes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its massive threats while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory through the sheer power of its creatures and mana acceleration.

This deck focuses on using lands to control the game while assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. It also utilizes Life from the Loam to recur lands, Crop Rotation to find key pieces, and Punishing Fire for removal. The deck includes various utility lands such as Rishadan Port, Glacial Chasm, and Maze of Ith to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, it has tools like Molten Vortex and Barbarian Ring for additional burn damage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through land-based control tactics.

The main concept of this Aluren combo deck is to efficiently utilize the Aluren enchantment to cast creatures for free, creating a loop of casting and bouncing creatures to generate advantage and potentially win the game. The deck includes a mix of control elements such as Force of Will and Abrupt Decay, along with powerful value creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Baleful Strix to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo. Deathrite Shaman also provides additional disruption and graveyard hate, making the deck versatile and resilient against various strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's spells, combined with powerful beaters like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger, the deck aims to establish control of the board and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice provide additional utility and reach. Overall, the deck seeks to keep the opponent off balance and secure victory through relentless aggression.

The main concept of the deck is to generate a large amount of mana through creatures like Deathrite Shaman, Nettle Sentinel, and Heritage Druid, while also using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to draw through the deck quickly. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Craterhoof Behemoth and Natural Order to deliver a powerful finishing blow. The deck also includes key utility cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to provide additional flexibility and protection for the combo pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while also leveraging the card draw provided by Glimpse of Nature and Elvish Visionary. It aims to flood the board with Elves and generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth with Natural Order. The deck also includes disruption cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to help maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large army of Elves and finish them off with a powerful attack.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Show and Tell with Omniscience to cheat in powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It includes a variety of card draw spells and counterspells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the combo with fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, along with fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Mox Diamond and Lotus Petal, then play powerful combo pieces like Through the Breach, Sneak Attack, and Nahiri, the Harbinger to cheat big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon help disrupt opponents' strategies while Seething Song provides additional mana acceleration. This Mono Red Combo deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and explosive plays, closing out the game with huge creatures or game-ending combos.

The key concept of the Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain board control and pressure the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman in combination with cheap disruption spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistency and maintain a steady stream of threats.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a strong board presence of Infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, then use pump spells like Invigorate, Become Immense, and Berserk to deal lethal poison damage to the opponent in a single attack. The deck is also packed with countermagic like Force of Will and disruption like Daze to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With efficient card draw and mana acceleration, this deck seeks to win the game before the opponent has a chance to establish their own strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by Stoneforge Mystic and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. True-Name Nemesis and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull help stabilize the board while applying pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up its own threats to secure victory. With a mix of control elements and powerful creatures, this deck seeks to outmaneuver and outvalue its opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.
